title: Masld-Related Hepatocarcinoma: Special Features And Challenges
content: Metabolic Associated Steatohepatitis Liver Disease (MASLD) currently impacts a quarter of the global population and its prevalence is expected to increase in the future. As a result, the incidence of hepatocellular carcinoma associated with MASLD is also on the rise. Notably, hepatocellular carcinoma in this group does not always develop alongside liver cirrhosis, often leading to a more advanced stage at diagnosis. The challenge lies in accurately identifying patients who are at a higher risk of hepatocellular carcinoma to tailor screening processes effectively. Additionally, several therapeutic approaches are being explored to prevent hepatocellular carcinoma, although there are yet no universally accepted guidelines
